title: Daniel Vargas Receives Research Fellowship
content: Our undergraduate student, Daniel Vargas, received the Gallogly College of Engineering Research Fellowship. This exclusive grant allows students to focus on their research and allow them to prosper in their work. He received the grant for his project: Search and Rescue Robotic System (SARRS.) He will be working on the project for the spring 2024 semester and is expected to complete the project by May 2024.

title: AirLab Participates in The Big Event
content: The underclassmen members of Airlab, Daniel, Tyler, and Yuki, were able to participate in this year's Big Event. The Big Event is OU's official day of community service. Pictured below are members Daniel and Tyler remulching for a local wild care foundation.

title: AirLab Welcomes Three New Members To Lab
content: AIROU is excited to announce the arrival of three additional members to the lab for this upcoming school semester. Welcome to the team, Avinash, Tate, and Maisha!

title: New Lab Set Up in Carson B12
content: AIROU's new lab has been successfully set up in Carson B12. This space will be used for testing and implementing various lab and research endeavors. This space also holds our 3D printer, computers, and other electronics. Currently, our member Daniel Vargas has been working on assembling our drones and MUSHr racecars in this lab space. Pictured below is the AIROU's first lab meeting here!

title: Oklahoma Transportation Research Day
content:
Last October, our lab members Daniel Vargas, Yuki Zheng, and Tyler Roman were able to attend the Oklahoma Transportation Research Day.
Daniel (pictured: bottom left) presented his work on the implementation of localizing and mapping with advanced AI for autonomous navigation, and presented his MUSHr racecar project our lab is using to test our visual navigation and simulations.

Yuki and Tyler (pictured: bottom right) presented their poster exploring AIROU's project for collaborative multi-view perception for a safe, robust, and scalable autonomous driving system. Some topics covered include 3-D multi-object detection, sensor fusion, multi-object tracking, collaborative learning, localization, and mapping.

title: New 3D Printer Set Up
content: A 3D printer has recently been set up in the lab to facilitate in the assembling of the lab's MUSHr racecars.

title: AIROU's First MUSHr Racecar Assembled
content: AIROU's first MUSHr racecar has been assembled and driven in the lab!
